title: Will the Political Instability Task Force (PITF) Worldwide Atrocities Dataset record an event perpetrated by a non-state actor in Honduras (HND) that starts between 1 September 2017 and 30 September 2017?
preds: This assassination of journalist Carlos Williams Flores in Tegucigalpa on 13 September 2017 looks like it would count:

https://www.ifex.org/honduras/2017/09/19/carlos-william-flores-killed/
"n Honduras, murdered on September 13, 2017 was journalist Carlos Williams Flores, who worked at Canal 22 television and hosted the program Sin pelos en la lengua (Without mincing words) in which he covered cases of irregularities in the local municipality. Unidentified persons riding motorcycles shot at him as he was returning to Cuyamel city in CortÃ©s province. A female employee of the channel who was accompanying him at the time was injured in the attack"
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

The probability (of non-state events in a month) has risen from ~19% in 2013-2015 to ~41% in 2016-2017. However, since I have no statistical basis to assume that this a significant trend, I have decided to take the probability for the whole 2013-2017 period.

current gjopen consensus is low % chance & consistent instability suggests that this month won't be a particular anomaly. There is an atrocity of this nature every handful of months, so probability that there will be one on a given month is moderate, but far from guaranteed.
In the most recent 18 months reported, there were 7 atrocities in Honduras. Assuming the same rate, that is 45%

wow PITF is a complex tool.  Selected press sources.  Vetted manually.  4 month lag on reporting... Human judgement about whether something was politically motivated, then throw in Honduras...   A CIA funded data base, US financial support for those currently in power, cooperation by Honduran leadership (obama and trump no less).  damn.  i say no report ...

According to the data set through July 2017, the last atrocity recorded was on 2/17/2017 and was by Unknown/Unclear/Other.  This lead me to initially assume the trend would continue and the probability would be low.  An August 25th article in the National Catholic Reporter by Linda Cooper and James Hodge indicates that the situation has not changed and points out that November elections will be contentious.  The tension between Juan Orlando Hernandez and the Opposition Alliance against the Dictatorship significantly increases the risk of an incident.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Honduras doesn't seem particularly present in the database in recent months, but situation remains unstable
Last five years (56 months) there have been 4 events attributable to non-state actors. No data explain frequency. September is just as likely as any other month.
Waffling again. Since the question could go either way, so will I.
Only 1 event in 2016; Honduras relatively calm at the moment.
per btawney precise reading of the question and also Guatemala's very recent potential for instability.
Reversing again. From my reading of the data, the answer could break either way. I'll stick with zero.
S American politics is murky, so I like them.  Interested to see if the current govt turns this into a political entity.

H/T to @btawney for pointing out that incidents perpetrated by 'Unknown/Unclear/Other' would close the question as a "yes." I missed that on my original readng of the explanation above. Reversing my forecast.

Looking at the data over recent years, the majority of events recorded for Honduras are 'Unknown/Unclear/Other' or 'Non-State, Internal, No State Sanction', either of which would count as a "yes" for this answer.

Who knows? I'm guessing zero - taking a stab in the dark, because I took a look at their data set and almost all of the atrocities listed for Honduras were perpetrated by "unknown/unclear/other," so I figure the odds are that while there will almost certainly be incidents reported in September 2017, PITF will be at a loss to attribute them to anyone in particular.

The most recent violent events recorded for Honduras in the January 2016-July 2017 PITF Worldwide Atrocities Dataset were targeted assassinations and gang related violence.  There were three separate events which resulted in a total of 14 deaths and all perpetrators were in the unknown classification.  The two targeted assassinations were of environmental activists and both occurred in March of last year.  An attempted assassination of an environmental activist occurred July, 4 of this year.  There also may be a power vacuum with the recent conviction and looming extradition of drug kingpin 'Chepe Handal'.  I believe there is a chance for gang violence or another assassination of an environmentalist.
PITF data for this case is not included in the dataset.

Just noticed I misread the date. Thought it was Sep 2017 to Sep 2018, instead of only Sep 2017. Significantly less likely given the relative calm of the past few months, and my newfound ability to read accurately.

Having worked in Honduras for a US multinational for a while I can say there is always violence and sometimes instability yet it was usually gangs or government caused except around election time.  I would be surprised if next month something occurs which would meet the guidelines of this question.
There haven't been any events since February so I don't think we see one in September.

Based on PITF data, there's apparently been 10 such incidents between January 2016 and July 2017, with no event since February 2017. So with 10 events in the last 19 months, it's in the realm of possible that at least one event occurs in the next 12 months. To better assess this question, I'll have to start digging into Honduran sociopolitical and economic issues to determine who the players are and the likelihood one of them commits an atrocity as defined by PITF.
